title: Strictly stars 'asked to contact ex-partners' over sexting leak fears
text:
Strictly promises more fame and fortune for the celebrity contestants (Picture: Ray Burmiston/BBC/PA Wire)

The stars of Strictly Come Dancing 2019 have reportedly been urged to contact ex-partners over fears their explicit pictures and videos will be leaked online.

Contestants have apparently been told by show producers that they need to be aware of the ‘prevalence’ and dangers surrounding the distribution of sexually explicit content through smartphones, according to a source from The Sun.

‘Obviously everyone has a history, and many of the celebs have probably done things in the past that they wouldn’t necessarily do now,’ the source claimed.

‘”Sexting” – the sending of saucy pics – is obviously a big deal right now, and very prevalent.

‘But all it takes is for a private photo or video to be sent on to someone else, and the next thing you know, the photo is circulating and being leaked online.’

The source later stated that the contestants’ duty of care is a priority to show bosses, with producers allegedly briefing them on how to ‘safeguard’ themselves against anything ‘embarrassing’.

‘Friends, partners and ex’s have all been asked for their discretion, and the hope is nothing else mortifying will emerge this series,’ they added.

Metro.co.uk have contacted reps for Strictly Come Dancing for comment.

Contestant Kelvin Fletcher has apparently been subject of a leaked nude video (Picture: PA)

It comes after it was previously reported that a video is doing the rounds online of Emmerdale actor Kelvin Fletcher parading around naked in a dressing room.

The 35-year-old had allegedly sent the video, which reportedly sees him perform star jumps in the nude, to friends in a group chat on messaging service WhatsApp, with a source telling The Sun that Kelvin was ‘dared’ by friends to film the video, as he thought it would never be shared outside of their group chat.

‘Kelvin was dared by his pals to film this video for a laugh,’ the insider stated.

‘He’s a real lads’ lad — he loves the banter and is very confident, so he didn’t hesitate to accept the challenge and strip off.

‘He never thought the clip would be shared with anyone outside that WhatsApp feed — but unfortunately he has been proved wrong.

‘I’m not sure Kelvin would want it coming out now he’s on a family show like Strictly.’

Despite this controversy, Kelvin has won the Strictly judges round once again with dance partner Oti Mabuse, after the two scored an impressive 38 points for their Charleston routine to Trip A Little Light Fantastic from Mary Poppins Returns.

Strictly Come Dancing continues tonight at 7:15pm on BBC One.
